result.execSummary:
The defendant Keenan Elon Ward was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Strangulation and Suffocation [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.235(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent with: 21CM958
Consecutive to: Any other sentence being served

superMiscConds.notes:
Maintain absolute sobriety.  No alcohol.  May not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional.  May not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol. 
No contact with EMG or EMG's family.
Maintain employment and/or continue with education.

DOC Collect.  If discharged from extended supervision with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Keenan Elon Ward

records.descr: Order Collection Biological Specimen DNA Analysis

records.addlTxt: 8:50 AM Defendant Keenan Elon Ward in court, in custody from the Rock County Jail.  Attorney C. James Fitzgerald in court for Keenan Elon Ward.  Attorney Kyle Edward Johnson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant pleads guilty to Count 1; Court finds defendant guilty.  Counts 2, 3 and 4 are dismissed and read in. Defendant waives right to presentence investigation.  Court orders 2 years Wisconsin State Prison and 3 years Extended Supervision, concurrent with 21CM958 but consecutive any other sentence being served, any treatment deemed necessary, maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol, may not possess or consume any controlled substances unless prescribed by a medical professional, may not enter any bars, taverns or establishments where the primary source of revenue is the sale of alcohol, maintain employment and/or continue with education, no contact with EMG or EMG's family, DOC collect costs, 0 days sentence credit. Defendant is not eligible for Substance Abuse or Challenge Incarceration Programs.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 26, 2022 at 08:45 am.
